header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: This work presents a system for developing supersensory powers through the esoteric understanding and application of the Tarot, specifically focusing on elevating consciousness to the superconscious level to achieve spiritual evolution and divine heritage.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 11: Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: This lesson introduces the concept of superconsciousness as the ultimate goal for spiritual development, attainable through esoteric practices involving Tarot, color, and sound. It posits that the Inner School, guided by Masters of Wisdom, helps disciples develop psychic faculties and absorb knowledge through a process akin to osmosis. The lesson contrasts self-consciousness, subconsciousness, and superconsciousness, using Tarot Key No. 0, The Fool, as an analogy for the expansive awareness of superconsciousness. It emphasizes that the level of awareness attained in physical life is carried into the after-death state and that the purpose of these lessons is to achieve this higher awareness while incarnated. The Fool is presented as a symbol of the principle of all Tarot keys and the superconscious intelligence that plans creation, carrying memory blithely rather than with sorrow. The lesson also touches upon the power of love, to be explored with Tarot Key No. 3, The Empress.

This section continues the exploration of superconsciousness, explaining that true cataclysms are illusions from a Higher Self perspective, and that life's challenges, such as sorrow and heartbreak, can lead to greater compassion and intelligence. It criticizes the materialistic worldview that equates possessions with happiness, stating that experiences, even tragic ones, are treasures that foster growth towards higher consciousness. The text asserts that the purpose of physical manifestation is to evolve self-conscious awareness of superconsciousness, which is hierarchical and controllable. It stresses the importance of maintaining focus on superconsciousness during psychic practice to avoid being misled by lower astral or subconscious phenomena. The superconscious level is described as inherently conscious, developing individual centers for cosmic powers according to a cosmic plan, with personalities serving as tools for the Higher Self.

This part addresses the fear that becoming consciously superconscious might lead to the loss of personality, clarifying that it does not. It highlights the evolution of human consciousness and the current vital step of becoming actively conscious on the superconscious level to attain dominion over psychic realms. The text acknowledges the prevalence of fear, sorrow, and loneliness but states they are no longer essential. The Fool represents the superconscious direction and the ability to move beyond sorrow with gaiety and security, serving as a guide for responding to life. The primary obstacle is identified as insecurity, which can be overcome through proper techniques. The importance of this preliminary practice is stressed because the practitioner's basic emotional and mental state will influence their psychic development, and the goal is to tune into positive levels. The principle of unity consciousness is invoked, stating that suffering is shared, and lifting oneself also lifts others. Aspirants are encouraged to cultivate inner security and gaiety, to hold love even when it seems impossible, recognizing that all experiences are connected to a part of our being and that psychic faculties involve tuning into the mass mind.

This section emphasizes the need to bring higher consciousness into the lower realms rather than intensifying negative states. It frames the practice as an announcement to the subconscious mind that superconsciousness is in charge, aiming to overcome hatred and insecurity. The text compares psychic faculties to dealing with infections or viruses, suggesting that negative states are contagious on a subconscious level. It urges practitioners to adopt an attitude of deserving happiness and love, releasing martyr complexes and self-pity, to reach higher levels of capability and share in the gaiety and security of the superconscious self. The mechanism of the method is explained through symbol manipulation, positing that symbols like those in Tarot keys reach deep subconscious levels. Each Tarot key is a focal point for a specific state of consciousness, and by tuning into them, correlated psychic faculties are developed safely. The power of Tarot is acknowledged, citing Carl Jung and Judge Troward, and it's described as the most potent tool for esoteric teaching. The importance of integrating psychological and psychic aspects of Tarot is highlighted for personality transmutation and supersensory perception development. A daily technique using Tarot Key 0, The Fool, is introduced to cultivate superconscious gaiety.

structure_content.chapter_title: Exercise for Tarot Key 0, The Fool
structure_content.summary: This chapter provides a specific visualization and affirmation exercise designed to attune the practitioner to the superconscious level of the Inner School. It involves seating comfortably, gazing at Tarot Key 0 (The Fool) for five minutes with deep breathing, then closing the eyes and visualizing oneself immersed in a pale yellow light. The Fool card is then visualized above, drawn down into the oval of light, and the practitioner is instructed to embody the Fool in three dimensions, experiencing its details and position. The exercise culminates in looking towards the 'next height' with wonder and adventure, feeling the Fool's attributes such as jaunty feather, sun's glow, and cloak of experience. The practitioner is to embrace joyous expectation and make a powerful affirmation of being the 'adventure of life,' eternal youth, an eternal traveler, and the 'flame of livingness,' with the security of attainment as their destiny.

key_concepts.definition: The highest level of awareness, characterized by knowing all things at once and simultaneously. It is the state of divine heritage and the goal of spiritual evolution, representing the Higher Self or Eternal Being.

The state of focused attention on one particular thing at a time, contrasted with the expansive awareness of superconsciousness. In the hierarchy of consciousness, what is superconsciousness to us is self-consciousness to the Masters of Wisdom.

A state where concepts are associated in a continuous, more or less unconscious process. It is contrasted with self-consciousness and superconsciousness, and practitioners are warned against being swept away by its 'rivers' or astral illusions during psychic work.

Represents the principle of all Tarot keys, the beginning and the end, and the superconscious intelligence that plans creation. It symbolizes gaiety, security, a blithe carrying of memory, and an adventurous outlook towards the unknown, standing at the edge of a precipice with poise.

An esoteric organization or guiding force that works through the Tarot, the Tree of Life, color, and sound to help disciples attain superconsciousness and develop psychic faculties. It is directed by Masters of Wisdom.

The eternal, superconscious level of being, referred to as the true 'I.' It is the guiding intelligence that plans destiny and uses personalities as tools for its development according to the Cosmic Plan.

Abilities such as clairvoyance, clairaudience, and clairsentience that can be developed through practices involving Tarot and attunement to superconsciousness. These faculties allow control over psychic levels and access to higher awareness.
The understanding that all beings are interconnected, leading to the recognition that suffering is shared. This principle underpins the idea that helping oneself also helps others.

practical_system.description: The system presented is a method for developing supersensory powers by consciously elevating one's state of awareness to the 'superconscious level.' This is achieved through esoteric study of the Tarot, specifically using symbolic visualization and mental attunement. The core mechanism involves understanding and embodying the archetypal energies of Tarot keys, which are presented as focal points for specialized states of consciousness. The practice aims to transmute personality, develop psychic faculties (clairvoyance, clairaudience, clairsentience), and attain a state of 'superconscious gaiety' and security, which is then carried into the physical and after-death states. The overall goal is spiritual evolution and the realization of one's divine heritage.
tools: Tarot Key 0 (The Fool card) for visualization and attunement.
The symbolic language and archetypes of the Tarot keys.
rituals: Daily visualization and rhythmic breathing exercise using Tarot Key 0, The Fool.
Mentally drawing the Fool card into an oval of pale yellow light and embodying its form.
Affirming joyous expectation and one's superconscious identity using provided affirmations or personal variations.

relevant_quotes.text: One cannot explain superconsciousness in self-conscious terms. The superconscious state is one of knowing all things at once and simultaneously.
When you drop your physical vehicle, the level of awareness that you have attained up to that point is the same awareness that you will take with you into the after-death state.
The Fool, in essence, holds within himself the principle of all the Tarot keys. He is the beginning and the end. He is the superconscious intelligence that plans creation.
Those who are tied to the world's materialistic point of view, correlating physical possessions with happiness, are the true poverty-stricken souls.

We shall help you in these lessons toward developing the ability to enjoy heaven here on earth. You cannot expect to experience illumination in heaven if you haven't attained the capacity for it here on earth.

It is superconsciousness that must guide us all the way; superconsciousness belongs to the Higher Soul, the Eternal Being. This is what you really refer to when you say 'I,' whether you are conscious of it or not.

This is the Fool; this is the superconscious direction. This is the recognition of that level of our being which knows our destiny, has planned our destiny, just as we plan the education of our children.
Almost always our real problem is the feeling of insecurity. This unnecessary negative state can be overcome with the proper techniques.
We must learn how to feel security in knowing that we are not what we seem to be. We must learn how to hold the feeling of gaiety in the face of an environment which does not help to promote it.
The ability to open up the channels represented by the Tarot keys works somewhat in this manner: We are basically symbol-manipulating creatures.
Tarot is not a mild tool. As a matter of fact, it is the most potent, as well as the most effective means for esoteric teaching and training that exists on this planet.

AFFIRMATION: "I am the adventure of life. I am eternal youth. I have come from the previous valleys of yesterday to the invigorating heights of today. I am the eternal traveler, journeying into the miracle of self-discovery. I climb gaily from height to height. Never a time I was not; never a time I will not be. I am sure of foot, adventuring with laughter. I am the flame of livingness; the security of attainment is my destiny."

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to practitioners and scholars of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in Tarot as a vehicle for spiritual development and psychic augmentation. It bridges traditional occult philosophy with practical psychological techniques, framing psychic development within a hierarchical model of consciousness. The emphasis on cultivating positive states (gaiety, security, love) as a prerequisite for psychic advancement is a key insight. Its focus on a specific Tarot key (The Fool) for foundational practice makes it accessible to beginners while linking it to a broader system of esoteric knowledge.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of students and aspirants of esoteric traditions, particularly those engaged with Tarot or seeking to develop their psychic and supersensory abilities. It is also relevant for individuals interested in spiritual psychology, consciousness studies, and the practical application of occult symbolism for personal transformation and higher attainment.
